data.text:
@vanessainstem 🙏🖤🌻"The greatest victory is that which requires no battle.
Supreme excellence consists of breaking the enemy's resistance without fighting.”  (Sun ?Tzu)
@vanessainstem @arianaelena97 I love that y’all know and support each other 💜
I’ve also been getting food delivered or microwaveable/quick food to cut down on kitchen usage time 😌

I’m also so grateful I can work from home for both my jobs at MIT and that I enrolled in solely online classes at the only 2 universities I could find that offered college credit for online non-degree Chem 2 & Physics 2 this semester (UMass & University of North Dakota) 🌟

I’m SO thankful that @arianaelena97 got me groceries. I’m also really grateful that MIT has such great testing capabilities that my sick roommate was able to get her COVID PCR result and keep me+the other roommate safe bc we were able to implement these precautions!

I gave the other roommate 2/4 government issued rapid tests while I tested at MIT & we determined that we weren’t the ones to give her COVID. I’ve only been outside to go on walks outdoors, take out garbage, gonna have to do laundry tmrw, and to get my COVID tests.

spraying Lysol before using shared bathroom & coordinating her shower times (COVID can linger in the air and I’m particularly wary of when she showers or brushes teeth), and I wear my mask in my room at all times (this one is overkill but I’m not sure how air moves in the apt)
Been taking maximum precautions: windows open everywhere in the apartment, masks on in shared kitchen & bathroom, air purifier in my room, moved furniture in my room away from door & shared wall,
